msItem.author: Ps.-Robert Grosseteste
msItem.title: Summa philosophiae
msItem.incipit: Philosophantes famosi primi fuerunt Caldei a tribus filiis Noe sanguinis vel institucionis originem trahentes
msItem.note: Text apparently missing between fols. 55-6 and 70-1 and at end.

listBibl.bibl: MS. E in the edn. by Baur, Grosseteste, 275-643

msItem.author: Robert Grosseteste
msItem.title: De forma prima omnium (= Ep. 1, first part)
msItem.explicit: et ei ex omni parte simile fingere

listBibl.bibl: Ed. by Baur, 106-11 (not noting this manuscript), our text beginning at 107/ 11.

msItem.author: Robert Grosseteste
msItem.title: De intelligentiis (= Ep. 1, second part)
msItem.incipit: Voluisti insuper a me scire quid senciam de intelligendis

listBibl.bibl: Ed. H. R Luard, RS 25 (1861), pp. 33-41.

msItem.author: Robert Grosseteste
msItem.title: Commentary on Aristotle, Physics
msItem.incipit: Cum scire et intelligere adquirantur ex principiis
msItem.explicit: et finietur motus et tempus cum oessabit hominum generacio
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit scriptum Lincol. Super libros phisicorum. Jesus, Maria, Johannes.
msItem.note: Grosseteste's notes have been extensively copied into margins: see Robert Grosseteste, Scholar and Bishop, ed. D. A. Callus (Oxford, 1955), 27.

listBibl.bibl: MS. D in the edn. by R C. Dales, Roberti Grosseteste ... Commentarius in VIII libros Physico rum Aristotelis (Boulder, CO), 1963, descr. xxviii-xxx.
Fols. 104ra/15-105ra is MS. F in the edn. by Baur, op. cit., 101-6.

msItem.author: Robert Grosseteste
msItem.title: De statu causarum
msItem.incipit: Aristotiles in primo Philosophie sue supponens causas esse quatuor
msItem.explicit: remotissima est yle, sc. materia prima
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit tractatus domini Lincol. : Roberti Grosted de statu, sufficiencia et ordine causarum. Jesus, Maria, Johannes.

msItem.author: Robert Grosseteste
msItem.title: De luce siue De inchoatione formarum
msItem.incipit: Formam primam oorporalem quam corpus esse nominat lucem esse arbitror
msItem.explicit: in musicis modulacionibus, gestilacionibus et rithmicis temporibus. Jesus, Maria, Johannes.

msItem.author: Robert Grosseteste
msItem.title: De colore
msItem.incipit: Color est lux incorporata perspicuo terminato
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit tractatus B. G. Lincol. de colore. Jesus, Maria, Johannes.

msItem.author: Albertus Magnus
msItem.title: De causis et processu universitatis
msItem.incipit: Difficultates que sunt circa tocius entis principia
msItem.explicit: et non ... assercionibus nostris inductas ... postulacionibus ...

msItem.author: Arnoul of Provence
msItem.title: De ortu scientarum
msItem.incipit: Cum secundum philosophum Aristotelem aliosque philosophos precipuos anima in prima sui creatione est quasi tabula nuda
msItem.explicit: Rethorica est sermocinalis sciencia raciscionativa ['racisciona'] circa questionem civilem terminand.
msItem.note: Attributed to Robert Kilwardby in the table of contents.
Added in another hand. Bale, Index, 383, cites a manuscript from Windsor, probably this.

listBibl.bibl: R-A. Gauthier, 'Arnoul de Provence', Revue du moyen aye latin, 20 (1963), 129-70

msItem.note: Table of contents includes the following items now missing: 'Albertus de origine statu et immortalitate anime. Secretum Sigillum Sancti Cipriani Cartaginensis episcopi et martiris. Confescio ejusdem Sancti Cipriani. Burley de divisione scienciarum.'

supportDesc.collation: Fols. 1-81 (items 1-4) have the remains of a series of quire signatures, letters and numerals in ink. Fols. 84-105 (arts. 5-6) have quire signatures, letters and figures in red, and fols. 106 to the end have another red series a-k. On fols. 148, 160, 171v and 184 a red cross appears in the gutter.

decoDesc.summary: By two hands. (Pächt and Alexander iii. 954):

history.provenance: Windsor, Berkshire, Royal collegiate chapel of St George: "L. E. ¶ [?]" (large flourished letters, followed by a sort of paragraph -- typical Windor style -- cf. particularly Bodley 141 (LC); on fol. ii verso. Rebound, but traces of chain mark show on the first leaf at foot about the middle. (MLGB3: inferred evidence).

Thomas Allen. On fol. 1 is Allen's number '44' (i.e. in the fol. section of his catalogue) and his hand is found passim. On fol. i is the Digby/ Allen inventory number 'A.6.' 'To Mr E. Dyer' on fol. 188v presumably refers to Sir Edward Dyer (d. 1607), from whom Allen may have received the volume: on him see DNB. On fol. 1 are Digby's motto and name.

recordHist.source: Description adapted (2025) from the Quarto Catalogue (W. D. Macray, Bodleian Library Quarto Catalogues IX: Digby Manuscripts, repr. with addenda by R. W. Hunt and A. G. Watson, 1999) and from Pächt and Alexander (1973). Quarto Catalogue, cols. 235–6 Quarto Catalogue (addenda), p. 96 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 1, p. 76

ref.title: MLGB3: Medieval Libraries of Great Britain

revisionDesc.change: Encode all information in Quarto Catalogue.
